courses.name: Introduction to Health: Determinants of Health & Health Care

cmCourseInfo.description: A multidisciplinary approach to understanding perspectives in health, health equity, and primary health care. Themes include critical discussion of the measurements of health outcomes and the socioeconomic and political factors that affect health, including neglected and marginalized populations in Canada and globally.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Health: Determinants of Health & Health Care

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Class sessions will occur online and students are highly encouraged to engage in these live sessions during scheduled class hours. The online class time will be used to present, discuss and critique various materials. These will include small group discussions and as well as class presentations. It is expected that students have, at minimum, audio access and, preferably, video access to properly engage in the synchronous discussions and presentations of materials. 

Synchronous lecture sessions will be recorded for later viewing; tutorial sessions will not be recorded, but tutorial-related materials will be made available as much as possible.

courses.name: Introduction to Research Methods in Health Studies

cmCourseInfo.description: Offers students in Health Studies a basic understanding of research design and data collection on health topics. Also assesses the usefulness of research and data collection in the formation of health policy.
cmCourseInfo.title: Introduction to Research Methods in Health Studies

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Delivery Instructions

Class sessions will occur online and students are highly encouraged to engage in these live sessions during scheduled class hours. The online class time will be used to present, discuss and critique various materials. These will include small group discussions and as well as class presentations. It is expected that students have, at minimum, audio access and, preferably, video access to properly engage in the synchronous discussions and presentations of materials.

cmCourseInfo.description: This two-semester course designation will permit students to gain academic credit for health studies pursued independently, or to participate in an ongoing health research project, under the supervision of a University of Toronto faculty member. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Independent Research in Health Studies

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions

For 'E' indicator courses: An application and College approval are required. Please contact Khamla Sengthavy for further information at: UC165, Monday to Friday, 9:00am-4:30pm, 416-978-8083, or khamla.sengthavy@utoronto.ca. Application, guidelines, and supplementary documents are available on the Health Studies website at: https://www.uc.utoronto.ca/health-studies This course is open to Health Studies specialist and major students.
